name: JW Marriott Hotel Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel as one would expect, helpful and service orientated staff make the stay just that little more special.
reviews.title: Good location situated between Ploen Chit & Nana BTS stations

likes.disliked: — Internet and PC usage @ over US$20 an hour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having booked a deluxe room, I upgraded to the executive level on the 23rd floor. Room was small but comfortable, with a great view of the surrounding area. Coffee percolator etc was provided, and large bathroom with tub, separate shower, and nice shower products. There was a comfortable single seater lounge chair from where I could watch tv and peer out the window to bustling Bangkok below. Also provided was a writing table and two chairs.
reviews.title: Great City Centre Hotel in Bangkok
the most bad hotel
reviews.text: Turn down service each night was great, with towels replaced, fruit bowl replenished, and a couple of orchid flowers and chocolates left on the bed. Ice bucket was also filled, all in all a nice touch.

Access to the executive lounge offered deluxe breakfasts which were ample if not a little ordinary. Free afternoon open bar, snacks all day and the usual offerings. If you have a laptop, internet access is free of charge, but I had need to use one of the two PC's available in the lounge, which while handy was overpriced at 200 baht per 15 minutes. Seems a bit petty to charge so much after already paying an extra 2000 baht a night for the lounge access.
reviews.title: was kind of dissappointed

reviews.text: Location was great, turn left on Suk road and it's 5 minutes stroll to Ploen Chit BTS station or turn right, and it's also 5 minutes stroll to Nana station.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for Business Traveler

likes.liked: — The Executive Lounge, Friendly and Helpful Staff
likes.disliked: — Increasing prices, Platinum Marriott Members seldom get upgrades to suites anymore, blah uninteresting pool

reviews.text: The J.W. Mariott in Bangkok is a suberb hotel. The service is impeccable from front to end. The rooms are in perfect condition, nice, clean and simply enjoyable for the business traveller. The overall design of the hotel is very appealing. The restaurants offer great food at reasonable prices by European standards. The overall service provided at this hotel is absolutly outstanding and of the highest quality. I can only highly recommend this hotel in the heart of Bangkok!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at the JW Marriott hotel in Phuket in the past, I expected something equally amazing in Bangkok. The hotel has a reputation as a top-class, five star hotel in a very central party of Bangkok.
reviews.title: A safe but boring choice

likes.disliked: — It could have been anywhere in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little disappointed though, for several reasons:
reviews.title: One of the best stays i have had in Bangkok
I'm a "Regular" at the JW Marriott Bangkok
reviews.text: - You really could be anywhere in the world here. The only thing that reminds you you're in Thailand is the artwork on the walls, of which there is a lot.
- Most guests are from the US or the Middle East, and treat the staff accordingly (not well). This has, in my opinion, led to a slightly lower standard of service than I've come to expect in Bangkok.
reviews.title: Nice for business, skip if you're a tourist

reviews.text: I highly enjoyed my stay at the JW Marriott Bangkok. The room was elegant, clean and spacious, delightful The bed was comfortable. Service was phenomenal. The gym was fine - new equiptment although not a lot of it. The pool was beautiful. The hotel common spaces are elegant and beautifully decorated. I have nothing to complain about at all.
reviews.title: an oasis of calm and beauty in Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the JW Marriott for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon in December last year. We thought the staff were fantastic, friendly and helpful - check in was easy and hassle free. Best part of the hotel is the convenience. It is located close to the skytrain - which we took everywhere.
reviews.title: So convenient

reviews.text: The concierge helped us organise our activities for the day and booked us into a show and gave us great directions on how to get there (we wanted to brave the skytrain and MRT instead).
reviews.title: Nice hotel, nice location

likes.disliked: — not being able to get the room type booked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was lovely and clean and we were given fresh fruit and water each day.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: The gym, day spa and pool are great. The pool area is not huge but we only went early in the mornings and always had it to ourselves.
reviews.title: Great Service - Very Nice

likes.disliked: — Too close to one of the

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a wonderful 4 days at this hotel as a base for our Bangkok sightseeing and cannot fault it in any way. Be prepared when you arrive to be persuaded to upgrade but it is not such a bad deal and worth looking at.
reviews.title: Wonderful choice for Bangkok

reviews.text: The service is exemplary and the staff all charming.
reviews.title: A fine US hotel....enjoy life in or out of the bubble

reviews.text: This JW Marriott is a luxurious well run American hotel in bustling Bangkok. That is the good news..... and a constraint.
reviews.title: Another Great JW Marriott

reviews.text: The good news? I enjoyed my comfortable well appointed room with more than the usual US amenities and a nice view. Courteous service on check in and check out. Strong support in business services. This hotel is located in a shopping and restaurant neighborhood with lively if seedy street scenes. It is between two skytrain stops that offer ready access to the rest of the city. If your destination is served by the skytrain, you will find transit faster than a cab during rush hours. Absolutely no complaints. Nice to be able to count on a reliable JW Marriott experience with a bit of the extra friendliness of Thailand.
reviews.title: First Class Experience

likes.disliked: — Although not expected, there was a constant flow in the evening of what appeared to be middle-aged foreigners with young Thai girls that we assumed to be pros., it provided interesting bar entertainment for me and my colleagues.

reviews.text: The limit? This is life within a US bubble, albeit a very nice bubble with Thai accents. Those interested in breaking out may do so easily. One morning, I walked east on Sukhumvit a few blocks, then north into a quiet upper middle class residential neighborhood. One afternoon, like many foreign visitors, I did the mandatory visit to Raj the tailor for custom fitted shirts and learned about the Punjabi subculture in Bangkok. On two days, Thai friends of longstanding took me into their homes and work. But with friends or without, try to break out of the international tourist/business bubble to get some sense of the ordinary lives of the millions of people of this amazing city.
reviews.title: Wowed by the JW

description: Discover one of the luxury hotels Bangkok offers, JW Marriott Hotel Bangkok.
